para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
“Deep fake” has the meaning stated in COMAR 33.13.07.02H(1).
“Political convention” means the act of a political party or central committee of the political party to select, nominate, or elect:
A replacement candidate to the ballot pursuant to Election Law Article, Title 5, Subtitles 9 and 10, Annotated Code of Maryland;
A member to the central committee;
A person for appointment to fill a vacancy in accordance with Article III, Section 13, of the Maryland Constitution; or
A candidate for the general election.

A person may not directly or indirectly give, offer, or promise money, aid, a gift, an advantage, a preferment, an emolument, or any other valuable thing to another person for the purpose of inducing or procuring that person to vote or refrain from voting for or against:
An individual, question, or measure at an election or political convention; or
The election of an officer by the General Assembly.

A person may not directly or indirectly receive, accept, request, or solicit money, aid, a gift, an advantage, a preferment, an emolument, or any other valuable thing from another person for the purpose of inducing or procuring a third person to vote or refrain from voting for or against an individual, question, or measure at an election or political convention.

A person may not vote or refrain from voting for or against an individual, question, or measure at an election or a political convention, in consideration of money, aid, a gift, an advantage, a preferment, an emolument, or any other valuable thing paid, received, accepted, or promised to the advantage of that person or of another person.
A person may not directly or indirectly give a contribution or contributions to a political committee in a name other than the person’s name.

Deep Fake. A person may not willfully or knowingly influence or attempt to influence a voter’s decision to go to the polls or to cast a vote by publishing, distributing, or disseminating material constituting or containing a deep fake within 90 days before an election without meeting the same requirements imposed on political committees under COMAR 33.13.07.02H.

section.heading: Penalty.
section.text: A person who violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is:

para.text: Subject to a fine not exceeding $1,000 or imprisonment not exceeding 1 year or both; and
Ineligible to hold any public or party office for 4 years after the date of the offense.

annotations.annotation: Election Law Article, §§2-102(b)(4), 13-602, and 16-201(a), Annotated Code of Maryland
